messages.subject: Diets/fish
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/1/03 2:31:17 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/1/03 2:31:17 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< We never ate fish when I was growing up (I still don't, usually). My
mom hated fish because her parents served it every single Friday and
every single time they served it, her mom would say, "Don't choke to
death on the bones." That effectively ruined her appetite for fish. >>

Aaaah....and I have all these lovely memories surrounding fish.
Maybe growing up in Alaska did it. :) We went fishing in the most incredibly
scenic area, near Valdez, ate our fresh catches and slept full and happy in a
smoke filled cabin.
I have warm fuzzies just thinking about it. Fishing with my Dad, the
excitement of the catch, the smell of fresh fish on the woodstove, Halibut
with creamy cheese sauce, laughter and stories and kerosene lamps hissing at
night.
Sigh....
No wonder I still like Salmon and Halibut!

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
